What are all the required fields, field types, supporting documents, official submission method,
                    governing authority, target users, and submission deadlines for the i-864 form?
                    Include official source URLs and detailed instructions.
answer: The I-864 form requires detailed financial information, supporting documents, and must be submitted to USCIS. Required fields include income, assets, and financial obligations. Submit supporting documents like tax returns and W-2s.

### What does the I-864 Form require?

The I-864 Form requires the sponsor to provide detailed information about their income, assets, and financial obligations. The sponsor's income must be at least 125% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines for their household size, except for sponsors on active duty in the U.S. Armed Forces who are sponsoring their spouse or child, in which case the income requirement is 100% of the Federal Poverty Guidelines. [...] To support the I-864 Form, the sponsor must provide supporting documents such as tax returns, W-2s, and employment verification letters. Specifically, the sponsor must submit a copy of their most recent Federal individual income tax return, along with a copy of each Form W-2 and Form 1099 related to those returns. If the sponsor chooses to submit an IRS transcript of their tax return, they do not need to include the W-2 or 1099 forms unless they filed a joint tax return and are relying solely [...] 2- Download and Complete Form I-864: You can download Form I-864 from the USCIS website. The form must be filled out in English, using black ink. Carefully follow the instructions and ensure all information provided is correct and up to date​.

3- Gather Supporting Documents: Along with the completed Form I-864, you will need to submit supporting documents, including:

A copy of your most recent Federal income tax return (IRS Form 1040).

### Additional Resources

# Tips for Filing Form I-864, Affidavit of Support Under Section 213A of the INA

This tip sheet will help you complete Form I-864, Affidavit of Support Under Section 213A of the INA. Detailed Instructions for Affidavit of Support are also available. When filing Form I-864, it is important to fill out the form completely and provide all required information with your initial filing. This will reduce processing delays and errors in communication. [...] The principal immigrant must submit one original Form I-864 for his or her file along with supporting financial evidence of the sponsor’s income. A Form I-864 is considered original if it is signed in black ink.

The principal immigrant should also submit photocopies of the completed Form I-864 for each family member traveling with him or her. Copies of supporting financial documents are not required for the principal immigrant’s family members.

Tips on completing Form I-864 [...] Please read and follow the filing tips to ensure proper processing.

Note: All 12 pages of Form I-864 must be submitted.

Who completes this form? The sponsor of an intending immigrant fills out and signs this form in black ink. If the sponsor is under guardianship, the guardian of that sponsor’s estate (financial affairs) may sign the form.
